unnormalised: Subject: My Yoga Journey and Finding My Zen
normalised: Subject: My Yoga Journey and Finding My Zen

unnormalised: Okay, so I've never really been the "yoga type." Always imagined those flexible folks contorting themselves into pretzels at some fancy ashram in Rishikesh. That seemed miles away from my life in Delhi! But after my doctor, Dr. Sharma, kept hounding me about stress levels during my check-up on 10/10/2023, I decided to give it a shot.
normalised: Okay, so I've never really been the "yoga type." Always imagined those flexible folks contorting themselves into pretzels at some fancy ashram in Rishikesh. That seemed miles away from my life in Delhi! But after my doctor, Doctor Sharma, kept hounding me about stress levels during my check-up on tenth October two thousand and twenty three, I decided to give it a shot.

unnormalised: Started with online classes, the kind you find on YouTube. Honestly, the first few sessions were hilarious. I couldn't even touch my toes, let alone do a proper downward dog! Felt like a total klutz. But I persevered.
normalised: Started with online classes, the kind you find on YouTube. Honestly, the first few sessions were hilarious. I couldn't even touch my toes, let alone do a proper downward dog! Felt like a total klutz. But I persevered.

unnormalised: Then I found a local yoga studio near my house in Dwarka. They offer classes at 07:00 hrs every morning. The instructor, a lovely woman named Priya, is incredibly patient. She modified poses for me and encouraged me to listen to my body.
normalised: Then I found a local yoga studio near my house in Dwarka. They offer classes at zero seven hundred hours every morning. The instructor, a lovely woman named Priya, is incredibly patient. She modified poses for me and encouraged me to listen to my body.

unnormalised: It's been about 6 months now, since my initial consultation with Dr. Sharma, and I can honestly say yoga has changed my life. My back pain, which was a constant companion after hours spent hunched over my computer for work, has significantly reduced. I sleep better, I'm less irritable, and surprisingly, I can now almost touch my toes!
normalised: It's been about six months now, since my initial consultation with Doctor Sharma, and I can honestly say yoga has changed my life. My back pain, which was a constant companion after hours spent hunched over my computer for work, has significantly reduced. I sleep better, I'm less irritable, and surprisingly, I can now almost touch my toes!

unnormalised: Just last week, on 26/01/2024 (Republic Day!), I even managed a semi-decent headstand – with Priya’s assistance, of course! It's a journey, not a destination, as they say. If a totally inflexible, stressed-out software engineer like me can find benefit, anyone can. Give it a try! Maybe you'll find your zen too. It’s more than just physical poses; it's about finding inner peace.
normalised: Just last week, on twenty sixth January two thousand and twenty four (Republic Day!), I even managed a semi-decent headstand – with Priya’s assistance, of course! It's a journey, not a destination, as they say. If a totally inflexible, stressed-out software engineer like me can find benefit, anyone can. Give it a try! Maybe you'll find your zen too. It’s more than just physical poses; it's about finding inner peace.
